Class NeoDailies

  • java.lang.Object
    • NeoDailies

  • public class NeoDailies
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class which embodies the entire program.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        The main method. Contains the loop where everything runs. It is the controller for all the automation.
        Parameters:
        argv - Not used, never used. Just Java syntax.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This should never happen, but Java requires it.

      • oncePerDay

        private static void oncePerDay(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                               java.lang.String xmlNode,
                               java.lang.String timeFormat)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles any activities which only need to be run once per day. Is only called from main.
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        xmlNode - The name of the node in the user's PreviousRuns.xml the program is looking for
        timeFormat - The SimpleDateFormat the program uses to get the current day or month. Only EEEE or MMM.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any Exception that occurred in the called methods that needs to be handled within main.
        See Also:
        oncePerInterval, oncePerSchedule, runTombola, runOmelette, runJelly, runPetPetBattles, runPyramids, runCheat, runSolitaire, runScarab21, runBank, runAltadorCouncil, runNeggCave, runShopOfOffers, runAppleBobbing, runAnchorManagement, runFruitMachine, runTDMBGPOP, runBattledome, runPotatoCounter, runKacheekSeek, runWiseOldKing, runGrumpyOldKing, runDailyPuzzle, runCrossword, runLunarPuzzle, runCliffhanger, runGeraptikuTomb, runForgottenShore, runMeteor, runIslandMystic, runMoodImprove, runFaeries, runLabRay, runStocks, runCoincidence, runLottery, runFoodClub, runCupcake, runMonthlyFreeby

      • runPetPetBattles

        private static boolean runPetPetBattles(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Plays PetPet Battles until the max games per day are played. Uses the algorithm of defending as much as it can, and then attacking. Once attacking, it changes attacks when the previous attack does no damage. This daily is useless unless you're going for the trophy.
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        Returns:
        A boolean telling if the activity successfully finished or not.
        See Also:
        oncePerDay

      • runPyramids

        private static boolean runPyramids(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Plays Pyramids until the max neopoints per day are earned. Searches from the left to right, going from bottom to top.
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        Returns:
        A boolean telling if the activity successfully finished or not.
        See Also:
        oncePerDay, runCheat, runScarab21, runSolitaire

      • runCheat

        private static boolean runCheat(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Plays Cheat until the max neopoints per day are earned. Never cheats if it can be avoided (best algorithm especially at higher levels).
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        Returns:
        A boolean telling if the activity successfully finished or not.
        See Also:
        oncePerDay, runPyramids, runScarab21, runSolitaire

      • runSolitaire

        private static boolean runSolitaire(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Plays Solitaire until the max neopoints per day are earned.
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        Returns:
        A boolean telling if the activity successfully finished or not.
        See Also:

      • runScarab21

        private static boolean runScarab21(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Plays Scarab 21 until the max neopoints per day are earned. Uses an algorithm based on forum advice and play experience. Will try to set up the board to hit a 21 as likely as possible.
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        Returns:
        A boolean telling if the activity successfully finished or not.
        See Also:
        oncePerDay, runCheat, runPyramids, runSolitaire

      • runBank

        Returns:
        A boolean telling if the activity successfully finished or not.

      • runNeggCave

        private static boolean runNeggCave(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Solves the Negg Cave puzzle daily. Uses the same solver code as TDN. Doesn't win 100% of the time because of ambiguous answers, but has a 95+% win rate.
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        Returns:
        A boolean telling if the activity successfully finished or not.
        See Also:
        oncePerDay

      • runStocks

        private static boolean runStocks(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Purchases 1000 shares of any stock currently at 15np per share. Uses the bargain stock list and grabs the first stock it sees at 15np.
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        Returns:
        A boolean telling if the activity successfully finished or not.
        See Also:
        oncePerDay

      • runCupcake

        private static boolean runCupcake(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Adopts a Neopet whose birthday is today, gets the current day's cupcake, and abandons the pet. The cupcake is then fed to the user's active pet. In other words, cupcake training.
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        Returns:
        A boolean telling if the activity successfully finished or not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Occurs if BirthdayList.csv doesn't exist, or if the date format is messed with (this should never occur).
        See Also:
        oncePerDay

      • oncePerInterval

        private static void oncePerInterval(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                    java.lang.String xmlNode,
                                    long requiredInterval)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles any activities which are run at minimum scheduled intervals. Is only called from main.
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        xmlNode - The name of the node in the user's PreviousRuns.xml the program is looking for
        requiredInterval - The amount of time in seconds the node requires to have passed.+
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any Exception that occurred in the called methods that needs to be handled within main.
        See Also:
        oncePerDay, oncePerSchedule, runStockSell, runTrudysSurprise, runExpellibox, runKikoPop, runKitchenQuest, runEmployment, runHealingSprings, runNeoMail, runGuessMarrow, runSymolHole, runColtzansShrine, runWishingWell, runFishing, runGraveDanger, runDubloonTraining, runIslandTraining, runSecondHandShoppe, runTarla, runShopTill, runDeleteItems, runStockItems

      • runStockSell

        private static boolean runStockSell(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Checks the user's stocks to find out if any are at 60np or above. According to NeoDaq, 60np is the golden number. If any are, sells all the user's shares of that stock
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        Returns:
        A boolean telling if the activity successfully finished or not.
        See Also:
        oncePerInterval

      • runStockItems

        private static boolean runStockItems(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                     java.lang.String callType)
        Checks if the user has less than 30 items in their shop. If they do, items are grabbed from their SDB and put in there to make it 30. If the user is running stock, the new items (and any item priced 0) are then priced. If they're running reprice, every item is then priced.
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        callType - The string telling whether to price just what is newly stocked, or to reprice everything.
        Returns:
        A boolean telling if the activity successfully finished or not.
        See Also:
        oncePerInterval

      • oncePerSchedule

        private static void oncePerSchedule(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                    java.lang.String xmlNode,
                                    int[] validHours)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Handles Snowager, depositing any money into the user's bank at the end of the day, and collecting the user's food club winnings.
        Parameters:
        driver - The WebDriver
        xmlNode - The name of the node in the user's PreviousRuns.xml the program is looking for
        validHours - The hour(s) that the program uses for the specified xmlNode
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Any IOException that occurred in the called methods that needs to be handled within main.
        See Also:
        oncePerDay, oncePerInterval
